Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

Flange Filter

Discussion

This filter is also used to to produce a swirling effect on a sound. The filter delays a copy of the sample data, but uses a low frequency oscillator to vary the speed of the copy's playback. (The oscillator moves in the range of 1-20 cycles per seconds to get the effect.) Feeding the processed signal back into the device to be processed again can get a more intense effect.

Preferences:

"Flange Feedback": Regeneration amount. Range: 0.09 to 0.9 %.

"Flange Rate": Rate of delay change. Range: 0.01 to 20.0 cycles per second.

"Flange Delay": Delay of flange signal. Range: 0.0 to 1000.0 millisecond.

"Flange Mix": Mix of flange signal. Range: 0.00 (original - dry) to 1.0 % (fully flanged - wet).


Group: Digital Filter Services
Related Sections: Chorus Filter, Phaser Filter, Ring-Amplitude Modulator Filter
